Job Title: Senior Director, Revenue Cycle Operations

Location: Nashville, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
As a Senior Director, Revenue Cycle Operations you will partner with Executive level client counterparts to deliver key operational results. Translate your industry expertise into strategic vision and generate client buy-in while driving your team to perform at a high level with superior outcomes.

To flourish in this role you will need to possess strong change management skills and have the ability to drive overall performance improvement initiatives allowing them to invest in their mission. You will act as a change agent to help establish common goals and create alliances across the hospital organization to optimize success.

This is a high-visibility role and will include daily interaction with our site leaders and executive leadership team. It may also include direct and indirect accountability of teams performing the daily analytical activities and improvement initiatives to drive revenue cycle performance.

Responsibilities

Lead performance improvement efforts by demonstrating an ability to personally identify and resolve complex revenue cycle challenges, then coach your team to adopt a similar approachYou will program manage in a matrixed environment. This is truly an exciting time of transformation and provides tremendous opportunity for lasting impact and influence. Work products will include financial analyses, process performance report creation, model and tool development, process flows, group meeting facilitation, and client relationship development. Active collaboration and standardization with various shared service functions to develop a one-team mindset.Interface with client executives and key customer contact points to report out on performance and address concerns on a regular basis.

Required Qualifications

10+ years of revenue cycle, finance or patient accounting experience, with 8+ years of management and leadership experience. A strong understanding of revenue cycle operations within an acute hospital, psychiatric hospital or surgery center setting and/or demonstrated, relevant domain knowledge. Experience solving problems in fast paced high pressure situations.Strong communication and leadership skills, while acting as a role model and coaching team members

For this US-based position, the base pay range is $121,915.50 - $190,173.00 per year . Individual pay is determined by role, level, location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

The healthcare system is always evolving — and it’s up to us to use our shared expertise to find new solutions that can keep up. On our growing team you’ll find the opportunity to constantly learn, collaborate across groups and explore new paths for your career.

Our associates are given the chance to contribute, think boldly and create meaningful work that makes a difference in the communities we serve around the world. We go beyond expectations in everything we do. Not only does that drive customer success and improve patient care, but that same enthusiasm is applied to giving back to the community and taking care of our team — including offering a competitive benefits package.

R1 RCM Inc. (“the Company”) is dedicated to the fundamentals of equal employment opportunity. The Company’s employment practices , including those regarding recruitment, hiring, assignment, promotion, compensation, benefits, training, discipline, and termination shall not be based on any person’s age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. Furthermore, the Company is dedicated to providing a workplace free from harassment based on any of the foregoing protected categories.

If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at 312-496-7709 for assistance.
